intro: Acourtia hintoniorum, commonly known as Hinton's acourtia, is a rare flowering plant native to specific regions of California. It belongs to the sunflower family (Asteraceae) and is characterized by its small, daisy-like yellow flowers. The plant typically grows in dry, rocky habitats and has adapted to thrive in arid environments. Its foliage consists of narrow, grass-like leaves that help reduce water loss.
